intro: Pneumonanthe glauca, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces clusters of small, sky-blue to white flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive silvery-blue appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Pneumonanthe glauca is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
